meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. While the kanji means <kanji>flip</kanji>, the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to billow</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to flutter</vocabulary>, as in some kind of material (maybe a dress or a flag) billowing or fluttering in the wind. It can also mean <vocabulary>to suddenly change</vocabulary> your mind, or your attitude, etc.
readingMnemonic: For something <vocabulary>to billow</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to flutter</vocabulary>, you'll need to ask the <reading>here guy</reading> (ひるがえ) - that's guy who's here right now - to open the window and let in the breeze.
